title: 110_s2872
content:
The Act titled "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2008" addresses the treatment of service-connected disability rated as total by reason of unemployability by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for purposes of the Social Security Act. The "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2008" allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be deemed under a disability for entitlement to Disability Insurance Benefits and other benefits based on disability. The "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2008" allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to receive benefits for a specified period, subject to periodic reviews to determine continued eligibility. The "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2008" allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to receive benefits for a specified period, subject to periodic reviews. If an individual determined to be totally disabled by the Secretary for unemployability ceases to be disabled, the Secretary must promptly certify this to the Commissioner. The Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will collaborate to implement these provisions. The collaboration between the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Commissioner of Social Security includes requirements for the Secretary to certify dates of service resulting in disability and report any individual engaging in substantial gainful activity, and for the Commissioner to provide names of individuals deemed disabled. An individual deemed under disability must notify Social Security and Veterans Affairs of work activity exceeding earnings set for substantial gainful activity. Other benefits based on disability include child's insurance benefits under specified regulations. The provisions of section 223(d)(7) apply to benefits and disability determinations under this section, similar to benefits under section 223. Widow's insurance benefits are also subject to these provisions under regulations of the Commissioner of Social Security. The provisions of section 223(d)(7) apply to benefits and disability determinations under this section, including widower's insurance benefits, as regulated by the Commissioner of Social Security. The amendment to Section 216(i) of the Act states that individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the VA for unemployability are expected to have the disability for at least one year. Individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the VA for unemployability for at least one year will be considered disabled for each month until the disability ceases or benefits are no longer entitled. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will certify to the Commissioner if an individual previously deemed totally disabled by reason of unemployability is no longer disabled. This does not prevent a disability determination under this title for individuals not covered under the previous subparagraph. The Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will collaborate to implement necessary arrangements for individuals under disability, including specifying service dates and promptly reporting any changes in disability status. The Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will collaborate to implement necessary arrangements for individuals under disability, including specifying service dates and promptly reporting any changes in disability status. An individual deemed under a disability must notify the Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs of any work activity exceeding the earnings level for substantial gainful activity. SEC. 3. Disability rated as total by reason of unemployability by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will be considered a disability for purposes of Title XVI of the Social Security Act. Section 1614(a)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions from section 223(d)(7) for disability determinations. 

SEC. 4. Medical findings by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for individuals with a service-connected disability will be applied for disability determinations under Titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act. Section 223(d)(5) of the Social Security Act is amended to include conclusive evidence of disability based on medical findings from the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for individuals with a service-connected disability. The Social Security Act is amended to treat veterans determined disabled as totally disabled for individual unemployability. The Social Security Act is amended to treat veterans determined disabled as totally disabled for individual unemployability without establishing service-connection. The Social Security Act is amended to terminate treatment for veterans if their disability rating is reduced or if the Commissioner of Social Security determines they are no longer disabled under titles II and XVI. The amendments made by this Act will apply to disability determinations for benefits or periods of disability filed after the enactment date.
